    • Field Detail

      • timeremaining

        public int timeremaining

    • Constructor Detail

      • Main

        public Main()
     throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor of Main Instance, initializing all GUI components, including toolbar, chessboard, countdownTimer. Also, load the data of all pieces, and set them into correct position. Record pieces with same color in a data structure for future use.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(board.Cell a,
                 board.Cell b)
        move all contents from a to b. Clear all contents of a, and if b has a piece before, remove it from the cell, and the data structure storing pieces with the same color.
        Parameters:
        a - from-Cell
        b - to-Cell

      • isCastling

        public int isCastling(board.Cell p,
                      board.Cell c)
        check if p to c can perform a valid castling action
        Parameters:

        c - to-cell

      • retrieveKing

        public piece.King retrieveKing(int color)
        Parameters:
        color - color of King we want to retrieve
        Returns:
        color = 1 => retrieve the white king instance; color = -1 => retrieve the black king instance.

      • transform

        public void transform(board.Cell c)
        remove all contents on Cell c, and set a new Queen instance of Cell c based on the previous piece's color.
        Parameters:
        c - Cell

      • filterDestination

        public java.util.ArrayList<board.Cell> filterDestination(piece.Piece p,
                                                         java.util.ArrayList<board.Cell> a)
        By analyzing the posMove list of Piece p, remove all the possibility that will cause a checkmate on the friendly king. (isKingInDanger in Piece.java used.)
        Parameters:
        p - Piece
        a - corresponding PosMove list
        Returns:
        list of Cell that can actually move to depends on the list a.

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent arg0)
        Evaluating the current situation and selected piece. Decide what kind of operation the user wants to do. Validate and decide to perform or not.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        arg0 - a mouseEvent

      • existPos

        public boolean existPos(int color)
        Iterate through the data structure storing the pieces with the same color, check if there exists any feasible movement that will remove the check state and will not invoke another check state.
        Returns:
        true if such movement exists; false otherwise
